intro: Echites glandulifer, commonly known as the glandular echites, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which contribute to its distinctive appearance. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, with a variety of colors ranging from white to pink. Echites glandulifer is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
